required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combined Use of a Novel Cardioplegic Formula With MPS® Versus Cardioplexol ® in Urgent Isolated CABG Using MiECC in Patients With Recent Acute Myocardial Infarction
clinical_study.official_title: Combined Use of a Novel Cardioplegic Formula With MPS® Versus Cardioplexol ® in Urgent Isolated CABG Using MiECC in Patients With Recent Acute Myocardial Infarction

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to compare the two cardioplegia solutions (blood cardioplegia by means of MPS ® vs. Cardioplexol ®) regarding perioperative outcome and with special attention to cardiac markers in patients with a recent heart attack.

primary_outcome.time_frame: patients with that received a coronary artery bypass grafting and that were treated (for approximately 15 days) at the University Hospital between February 2010 and January 2020 (data taken perioperative during hospital stay for CABG)
primary_outcome.description: Analyse cardiac biomarkers as indicators for myocardial damage: high sensitive troponin (Ths-TrT, ng/mL), creatine kinase (CK, in ng/mL) and creatine kinase-MB isoenzyme (CK-MB, in ng/mL)

secondary_outcome.description: death after coronary artery bypass grafting

secondary_outcome.measure: length of stay in the intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: perioperative during hospital stay for CABG (for approximately 15 days)
secondary_outcome.description: duration of stay at intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: perioperative during hospital stay for CABG (for approximately 15 days)
secondary_outcome.description: bleeding complication after coronary artery bypass grafting

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with postoperative arrhythmia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: perioperative during hospital stay for CABG (for approximately 15 days)
secondary_outcome.description: rhythm disturbance after coronary artery bypass grafting

arm_group.description: bypass surgery with blood cardioplegia by means of MPS
bypass surgery with blood cardioplegia by means of Cardioplexol ®

intervention.description: cardioplegia solution, A separate pumpsystem by which Blood cardioplegia with individually composable additives as cardioplegia solution can be used

study_pop.textblock: Patients which underwent isolated CABG (coronary artery bypass grafting) using MiECC (Minimal extracorporeal circulation system) at the department of cardial surgery University Hospital Basel Switzerland

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent a CABG using MPS® or Cardioplexol ®
- Heart attack less than 7 days before surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- use of other cardioplegia solution than Cardioplexol ® or MPS®
- other inventions than CABG
- explicit will of the patient that his data may not be used
- denied general consent

overall_official.affiliation: Cardiac Surgery Clinic, University Hospital Basel

facility.name: Cardiac Surgery Clinic University Hospital Basel
